properties.name: formId
properties.description: Form ID (e.g. aSAvYreNzVEkrWg5Gdcvg). Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: download
options.description: Whether to download submitted attachments

options.name: dataPropertyAttachmentsPrefixName
options.description: Prefix for name of the binary property to which to write the attachments. An index starting with 0 will be added. So if name is "attachment_" the first attachment is saved to "attachment_0"

options.name: version
options.description: Attachment size to retrieve, if multiple versions are available

options.name: selectMask
options.description: Comma-separated list of wildcard-style selectors for fields that should be treated as multiselect fields, i.e. parsed as arrays.

options.name: numberMask
options.description: Comma-separated list of wildcard-style selectors for fields that should be treated as numbers

options.name: reformat
options.description: Whether to apply some reformatting to the submission data, such as parsing GeoJSON coordinates

values.name: code
values.hint: This code will only run and return data if a "Main" input & output got created.

values.name: code
values.default:
const { WikipediaQueryRun } = require( '@langchain/community/tools/wikipedia_query_run');
return new WikipediaQueryRun();
values.hint: This code will only run and return data if an output got created which is not "Main".

properties.description: The language to use for translation of the input text, set to one of the language codes listed in Language Support. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: from
options.description: The language code in the format language code_code of the country. If this parameter is not present, the auto-detect language mode is enabled. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: translateMode
options.description: Describe the input text format. Possible value is "html" for translating and preserving html structure. If value is not specified or is other than "html" than plain text is translating.

name: n8n-nodes-base.localFileTrigger
description: Triggers a workflow on file system changes

properties.name: events

options.name: File Added
options.description: Triggers whenever a new file was added

options.name: File Changed
options.description: Triggers whenever a file was changed

options.name: File Deleted
options.description: Triggers whenever a file was deleted

options.name: Folder Added
options.description: Triggers whenever a new folder was added

options.name: Folder Deleted
options.description: Triggers whenever a folder was deleted

properties.description: The events to listen to

options.name: awaitWriteFinish
options.description: Whether to wait until files finished writing to avoid partially read

options.name: followSymlinks
options.description: Whether linked files/folders will also be watched (this includes symlinks, aliases on MacOS and shortcuts on Windows). Otherwise only the links themselves will be monitored).

options.name: ignored
options.description: Files or paths to ignore. The whole path is tested, not just the filename.Supports Anymatch- syntax. Regex patterns may not work on macOS. To ignore files based on substring matching, use the 'Ignore Mode' option with 'Contain'.

options.name: ignoreInitial
options.description: Whether to ignore existing files/folders to not trigger an event

options.name: depth
options.description: How deep into the folder structure to watch for changes

options.name: usePolling
options.description: Whether to use polling for watching. Typically necessary to successfully watch files over a network.

options.name: ignoreMode
Match
options.description: Ignore files using regex patterns (e.g., **/*.txt), Not supported on macOS

options.name: Contain
options.description: Ignore files if their path contains the specified value
Whether to ignore files using regex matching (Anymatch patterns) or by checking if the path contains a specified value

properties.name: include
properties.description: How to select the tools you want to be exposed to the AI Agent

options.name: All
options.description: Also include all unchanged fields from the input

options.name: Selected
options.description: Also include the tools listed in the parameter "Tools to Include"

options.name: All Except
options.description: Exclude the tools listed in the parameter "Tools to Exclude"

properties.name: includeTools
properties.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

properties.name: excludeTools

properties.name: options
properties.description: Additional options to add

options.name: timeout
options.description: Time in ms to wait for tool calls to finish

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic to publish to

properties.name: sendInputData
properties.description: Whether to send the data the node receives as JSON

properties.name: message
properties.description: The message to publish

options.name: qos
options.description: QoS subscription level

options.name: retain
options.description: Normally if a publisher publishes a message to a topic, and no one is subscribed to that topic the message is simply discarded by the broker. However the publisher can tell the broker to keep the last message on that topic by setting the retain flag to true.

properties.name: toolDescription
properties.description: Explain to the LLM what this tool does, a good, specific description would allow LLMs to produce expected results much more often

properties.name: topic
properties.description: The topic to publish to

properties.name: sendInputData
properties.description: Whether to send the data the node receives as JSON

properties.name: message
properties.description: The message to publish

options.name: qos
options.description: QoS subscription level

options.name: retain
options.description: Normally if a publisher publishes a message to a topic, and no one is subscribed to that topic the message is simply discarded by the broker. However the publisher can tell the broker to keep the last message on that topic by setting the retain flag to true.

properties.name: topics
properties.description: Topics to subscribe to, multiple can be defined with comma. Wildcard characters are supported (+ - for single level and # - for multi level). By default all subscription used QoS=0. To set a different QoS, write the QoS desired after the topic preceded by a colom. For Example: topicA:1,topicB:2

options.name: jsonParseBody
options.description: Whether to try parse the message to an object

options.name: onlyMessage
options.description: Whether to return only the message property

options.name: parallelProcessing
options.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order

options.name: Send
options.description: Send SMS

properties.name: from
properties.description: The number from which to send the message

properties.name: to
properties.description: The number, with coutry code, to which to send the message

properties.description: The message to send

properties.name: events
properties.description: The events that can trigger the webhook and whether they are enabled

options.name: Campaign Sent
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a campaign is sent or cancelled

options.name: Cleaned
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's email address is cleaned from the list

options.name: Email Address Updated
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's email address is changed

options.name: Profile Updated
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a subscriber's profile is updated

options.name: Subscribe
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a list subscriber is added

options.name: Unsubscribe
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered when a list member unsubscribes

properties.name: sources
properties.description: The possible sources of any events that can trigger the webhook and whether they are enabled

options.name: User
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by subscriber-initiated actions

options.name: Admin
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by admin-initiated actions in the web interface

options.name: API
options.description: Whether the webhook is triggered by actions initiated via the API

name: n8n-nodes-base.mailerLiteTrigger
description: Starts the workflow when MailerLite events occur

properties.name: event

options.name: Campaign Sent
options.description: Fired when campaign is sent

options.name: Subscriber Added Through Webform
options.description: Fired when a subscriber is added though a form

options.name: Subscriber Added to Group
options.description: Fired when a subscriber is added to a group

options.name: Subscriber Automation Completed
options.description: Fired when subscriber finishes automation

options.name: Subscriber Automation Triggered
options.description: Fired when subscriber starts automation

options.name: Subscriber Bounced
options.description: Fired when an email address bounces

options.name: Subscriber Complained
options.description: Fired when subscriber marks a campaign as a spam

options.name: Subscriber Created
options.description: Fired when a new subscriber is added to an account

options.name: Subscriber Removed From Group
options.description: Fired when a subscriber is removed from a group

options.name: Subscriber Unsubscribe
options.description: Fired when a subscriber becomes unsubscribed

options.name: Subscriber Updated
options.description: Fired when any of the subscriber's custom fields are updated

properties.description: The events to listen to
